body:
I recently created a NSFW guild, but as I'm posting in it, all of the posts are showing up in the new feed for all users to see.

In theory this should be OK, but in practice there may be multiple dozens of posts per day in the guild. If this shows for everyone then the New feed would be FLOODED with NSFW content, to the exclusion of all else. 

I would like to have an option so that only people who are specifically looking for the content will see it.  This is just to be polite to the other users and not force them to see graphic NSFW content when browsing New.
body_html:
I recently created a NSFW guild, but as I'm posting in it, all of the posts are showing up in the new feed for all users to see.

In theory this should be OK, but in practice there may be multiple dozens of posts per day in the guild. If this shows for everyone then the New feed would be FLOODED with NSFW content, to the exclusion of all else.

I would like to have an option so that only people who are specifically looking for the content will see it. This is just to be polite to the other users and not force them to see graphic NSFW content when browsing New.
title: Suggestion: Allow guild master the option to hide posts in guild from the "New" feed, especially for NSFW subreddits

body: There is an option to hide NSFW content in settings, so people can hide it on their end instead of on your end.
body_html: There is an option to hide NSFW content in settings, so people can hide it on their end instead of on your end.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

body:
I think this would be better accomplished by a setting that allows us to only see new posts from guilds we've joined.

Edit: just curious, what's the guild?  I might want to join it.

I recently created a NSFW guild, but as I'm posting in it, all of the posts are showing up in the new feed for all users to see.

In theory this should be OK, but in practice there may be multiple dozens of posts per day in the guild. If this shows for everyone then the New feed would be FLOODED with NSFW content, to the exclusion of all else.

I would like to have an option so that only people who are specifically looking for the content will see it. This is just to be polite to the other users and not force them to see graphic NSFW content when browsing New.
post.title: Suggestion: Allow guild master the option to hide posts in guild from the "New" feed, especially for NSFW subreddits

body:
It was +Bondage. I made 4 posts and then realized that all of the "normies" were seeing it too. 

I know that it's allowed, but I'd rather not force that kind of content into people's eyeballs when they weren't expecting it.  And I also know that people can individually turn of NSFW content, but I'd rather make my guild be Opt-In rather than Opt-Out.
body_html:
It was +Bondage. I made 4 posts and then realized that all of the "normies" were seeing it too.

I know that it's allowed, but I'd rather not force that kind of content into people's eyeballs when they weren't expecting it. And I also know that people can individually turn of NSFW content, but I'd rather make my guild be Opt-In rather than Opt-Out.
